info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 10:12AM EDT until May 31 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall has been reported by the public and is expected to continue.
* WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following county, Columbia.
* WHEN...Until 115 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1005 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past six hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hudson, Chatham, Claverack, Coxsackie, New Lebanon, Valatie, Athens, Austerlitz, Philmont, Kinderhook, Claverack-Red Mills, Lorenz Park, Ghent, Stockport, Stuyvesant, Hillsdale, Canaan, Taghkanic, Arnolds Mill and Buckleyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
